intro: Notholaena gilliesii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in panicles, typically blooming in spring. Notholaena gilliesii is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. It plays an important role in the ecological systems of New Zealand, providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
